014package org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.customizer.internal;
015
016import java.lang.annotation.Annotation;
017import java.lang.reflect.Method;
018import java.lang.reflect.Parameter;
019import java.lang.reflect.Type;
020import java.util.Arrays;
021
022import org.jdbi.v3.core.internal.IterableLike;
023import org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.customizer.BindMethodsList;
024import org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.customizer.SqlStatementCustomizerFactory;
025import org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.customizer.SqlStatementParameterCustomizer;
026import org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.internal.ParameterUtil;
027
028public final class BindMethodsListFactory implements SqlStatementCustomizerFactory {
029    @Override
030    public SqlStatementParameterCustomizer createForParameter(Annotation annotation,
031                                                              Class<?> sqlObjectType,
032                                                              Method method,
033                                                              Parameter param,
034                                                              int index,
035                                                              Type paramType) {
036        final BindMethodsList bindMethodsList = (BindMethodsList) annotation;
037        final String name = ParameterUtil.findParameterName(bindMethodsList.value(), param)
038            .orElseThrow(() -> new UnsupportedOperationException("A @BindMethodsList parameter was not given a name, "
039                + "and parameter name data is not present in the class file, for: "
040                + param.getDeclaringExecutable() + "::" + param));
041
042        return (stmt, arg) -> {
043            if (arg == null) {
044                throw new IllegalArgumentException("argument is null; null was explicitly forbidden on BindMethodsList");
045            }
046
047            stmt.bindMethodsList(name, IterableLike.iterable(arg), Arrays.asList(bindMethodsList.methodNames()));
048        };
049    }
050}
